history.content:
I took both CS0 and Stat134 and yes, it is a good decision to make since Stat134 is basically the second part of CS70 but with a slower pace.

In my semester, Stat134 did not cover Markov chain and LLSE&MMSE, which are both covered at the end of CS70. But Stat134 does cover Moment Generating Function which is only mentioned in CS70. 

They are a good combo to study probability section. Also, both CS70 and Stat134 have complementary 1 unit course (CSM session for CS70) for extra practice and you can take good use of them.

--

I took these two together last semester and IMO it's a mixed bag. For the first half of the semester, the classes cover completely different material, so 134 will only increase your workload. But 134 covers 95% of the probability material before 70 gets to it, so the second half of the class felt very easy. All in all though I wouldn't take both courses together if you're concerned about getting a B+, since it might be better to just focus on studying for 70 than to take another tech. You could always use the online 140 textbook (or something like that) to study continuous probability in more depth than what 70 has. If you don't care about your 134 grade at all though it won't really matter I guess.

children.subject: Materials are almost the same. Stat140 has more workload than 134 (labs and a few more topics about inference), but it's worthwhile if you are in ML related path.
so cs70 and stat 140 in the same semester is doable?
you won't be able to get into STAT 140 at this point.
The only thing that's dragging me down from the B+ is probability tho - I'm p solid on discrete. Def glad to know 134 covers most of 70's probability beforehand :D

history.content: I'm taking cs 70 rn in the summer and I'm getting absolutely destroyed by the probability section. I was wondering, if I drop now, would it be a good idea to take Stat 134 and CS 70 in the fall together (I need a B+ in the class)? I feel like I have a solid grasp on discrete probability.
history.subject: Stat 134 and CS 70?
